title: How to Make a Dollhouse Plant from Twist Ties

steps.headline: Lay out a bunch of twist ties (sandwich bag holders) into various lengths.
steps.description: Decide how many of these you'd like to form the plant. Bear in mind too that the amount will depend on how many can be fitted into the bead's hole.

steps.headline: Cut the twist ties at various levels.
steps.description: Plant stalks are never at one single level in nature, they vary. Hence, cut the twist tie lengths into long, medium and short lengths, to provide natural variation.

steps.headline: Use a fine brush to paint the twist ties.
steps.description: Choose a paint that is suitable for either paper or plastic surfaces, depending in what the twist ties are made of. Dark purple, deep oranges or reds, etc. are other color possibilities.

steps.headline: Allow to dry.
steps.description: When dry, they are ready to be turned into a plant.

steps.headline: Begin placing the twist ties into the bead hole.
steps.description: Glue the smallest ones into the bead first. Put glue on each end of the twist tie. Insert the ends with the glue on them into the inside of the bead. Arrange the small twist ties so that they form a mushroom-like shape.

steps.headline: Glue on the medium ones next, then the larger ones.
steps.description: For the large ties, you do not have to glue both ends of the tie; you can arrange them to stand tall, to provide the illusion of branches.

steps.headline: Let it dry.
steps.description: The model plant is now ready for placing in your dollhouse.

text: Preparing the twist ties Lay out a bunch of twist ties (sandwich bag holders) into various lengths. Decide how many of these you'd like to form the plant. Bear in mind too that the amount will depend on how many can be fitted into the bead's hole. Cut the twist ties at various levels. Plant stalks are never at one single level in nature, they vary. Hence, cut the twist tie lengths into long, medium and short lengths, to provide natural variation. Decorating the plant Use a fine brush to paint the twist ties. Choose a paint that is suitable for either paper or plastic surfaces, depending in what the twist ties are made of. Dark purple, deep oranges or reds, etc. are other color possibilities. Allow to dry. When dry, they are ready to be turned into a plant. Making the plant Begin placing the twist ties into the bead hole. Glue the smallest ones into the bead first. Put glue on each end of the twist tie. Insert the ends with the glue on them into the inside of the bead. Arrange the small twist ties so that they form a mushroom-like shape. Glue on the medium ones next, then the larger ones. For the large ties, you do not have to glue both ends of the tie; you can arrange them to stand tall, to provide the illusion of branches. Let it dry. The model plant is now ready for placing in your dollhouse.
